title: sort
lessonContent:
The sort command is useful for sorting lines. 
file1.txt
dog
cow
cat
elephant
bird

$ sort file1.txt
bird
cat
cow
dog
elephant
You can also do a reverse sort: 
$ sort -r file1.txt
elephant
dog
cow
cat
bird
And also sort via numerical value: 
$ sort -n file1.txt
bird
cat
cow
elephant
dog
exercise:
The real power of sort comes with its ability to be combined with other commands, try the following command and see what happens? 
$ ls /etc | sort -rn
quizQuestion: What flag do you use to do a reverse sort?
